{{Short description|Family name}}
==Al-Jawhar (surname)==


'''Al-Jawhar''' ([[Andalusian Arabic]]: الجوهر) is an [[Arabic]] [[surname]] meaning "the jewel" or "essence." It is primarily found in various regions of the [[Middle East]] and among [[diaspora]] communities. The surname and its variants have historical and cultural significance, and were used by [[Jews]] in the medieval kingdom of [[Navarre]]. Al-Jawhar has been associated with families of [[prominence]] in trade, scholarship, and [[governance]].<ref>{{cite web |title=Aljohar |website=Behind the Name |url=https://www.behindthename.com/name/aljohar/submitted |access-date=2026-02-08}}</ref>

It is primarily found in various regions of the [[Middle East]] and among [[diaspora]] communities. The surname and its variants have historical and cultural significance, and were used by [[Jews]] in the medieval kingdom of [[Navarre]]. The '''Lycée Edmond Perrier''' ([[Edmond Perrier]] high school) is a general and technical secondary education institution, located in [[Tulle]], [[Correze]]. It is dedicated to zoologist [[Edmond Perrier]], born in [[Tulle]] in 1844. It was built by [[Anatole de Baudot]], and has many similarities with the [[Lycée Lakanal]], due to the same architect.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Anatole de Baudot - Lycée Edmond Perrier |url=https://www.edmondperrier.fr/Anatole-de-Baudot |access-date=2026-02-07 |website=www.edmondperrier.fr}}</ref>{{Primary source inline}} His motto is "''Sint rupes virtutis iter''", identical to that of Tulle which means "The difficulties are the path of virtue".<ref name=":0">{{Cite news |title=Presentation_bts_sam_anglais_V2.pdf |url=https://www.edmondperrier.fr/upload/Presentation_bts_sam_anglais_V2.pdf}}</ref>{{Primary source inline}}
The '''Lycée Edmond Perrier''' ([[Edmond Perrier]] high school) is a general and technical secondary education institution, located in [[Tulle]], [[Correze]]. It is dedicated to zoologist [[Edmond Perrier]], born in [[Tulle]] in 1844. It was built by [[Anatole de Baudot]], and has many similarities with the [[Lycée Lakanal]], due to the same architect.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Anatole de Baudot - Lycée Edmond Perrier |url=https://www.edmondperrier.fr/Anatole-de-Baudot |access-date=2026-02-07 |website=www.edmondperrier.fr}}</ref>{{Primary source inline|date=February 2026}} His motto is "''Sint rupes virtutis iter''", identical to that of Tulle which means "The difficulties are the path of virtue".<ref name=":0">{{Cite news |title=Presentation_bts_sam_anglais_V2.pdf |url=https://www.edmondperrier.fr/upload/Presentation_bts_sam_anglais_V2.pdf}}</ref>{{Primary source inline|date=February 2026}}


==History==
==History==
Line 60: Line 60:
The Buildings were designed by the architect [[Anatole de Baudot]] and they were inaugurated on 1 October 1887. The buildings are made to provide comfort to students with large windows, high ceilings, heated rooms and an ideal living environment, which was revolutionary for its time.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Lycée Edmond-Perrier - POP |url=https://pop.culture.gouv.fr/notice/merimee/PA19000001 |access-date=2026-02-07 |website=pop.culture.gouv.fr}}</ref>
The Buildings were designed by the architect [[Anatole de Baudot]] and they were inaugurated on 1 October 1887. The buildings are made to provide comfort to students with large windows, high ceilings, heated rooms and an ideal living environment, which was revolutionary for its time.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Lycée Edmond-Perrier - POP |url=https://pop.culture.gouv.fr/notice/merimee/PA19000001 |access-date=2026-02-07 |website=pop.culture.gouv.fr}}</ref>


4 August 1914, just three days after the start of World War I, the school served as a barracks in the 300th Infantry Regiment. A week later, it turned into a military hospital and receives its first wounded on 26 August. In October 1916 it became again a center for teaching and study.<ref>{{Cite web |title=L'établissement - Lycée Edmond Perrier |url=https://www.edmondperrier.fr/L-etablissement |access-date=2026-02-07 |website=www.edmondperrier.fr}}</ref>{{Primary source inline}}

'''''Trisha Illana Nayanthara''''' ({{translation|If Not [[Trisha Krishnan|Trisha]], Then [[Nayanthara]]}}) is a 2015 Indian [[Tamil language]] [[sex comedy]] film written and directed by [[Adhik Ravichandran]], in his directorial debut. The film stars [[G. V. Prakash Kumar]], [[Anandhi (actress)|Anandhi]] and [[Manisha Yadav]],<ref>{{Cite web |last=Kavirayani |first=Suresh |date=3 July 2015 |title=Kissing scene didn't need 36 retakes: Manisha Yadav |url=https://www.deccanchronicle.com/150703/entertainment-kollywood/article/kissing-scene-didn%E2%80%99t-need-36-retakes-manisha-yadav |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150704074407/http://www.deccanchronicle.com/150703/entertainment-kollywood/article/kissing-scene-didn%E2%80%99t-need-36-retakes-manisha-yadav |archive-date=4 July 2015 |access-date=26 July 2015 |website=[[Deccan Chronicle]]}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |date=4 July 2015 |title=When actor GV Prakash Kumar kissed Manisha Yadav 36 times |url=http://www.hindustantimes.com/regional/trisha-illana-nayanthara-s-lip-lock-scene-took-36-takes/article1-1365587.aspx |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150704080627/http://www.hindustantimes.com/regional/trisha-illana-nayanthara-s-lip-lock-scene-took-36-takes/article1-1365587.aspx |archive-date=4 July 2015 |access-date=26 July 2015 |website=[[Hindustan Times]] |agency=[[IANS]]}}</ref> with [[VTV Ganesh]] and [[Simran (actress)|Simran]] portraying supporting roles.<ref>{{Cite web |title=First Look: 'Trisha Illana Nayanthara' |url=http://www.sify.com/movies/first-look--trisha-illana-nayanthara-imagegallery-kollywood-pc2qTnjecihcb.html |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150420013113/http://www.sify.com/movies/first-look--trisha-illana-nayanthara-imagegallery-kollywood-pc2qTnjecihcb.html |archive-date=20 April 2015 |access-date=4 June 2015 |website=[[Sify]]}}</ref> The film was released on 17 September 2015.
'''''Trisha Illana Nayanthara''''' ({{translation|If Not [[Trisha Krishnan|Trisha]], Then [[Nayanthara]]}}) is a 2015 Indian [[Tamil language]] [[sex comedy]] film written and directed by [[Adhik Ravichandran]], in his directorial debut. The film stars [[G. V. Prakash Kumar]], [[Anandhi (actress)|Anandhi]] and [[Manisha Yadav]],<ref>{{Cite web |last=Kavirayani |first=Suresh |date=3 July 2015 |title=Kissing scene didn't need 36 retakes: Manisha Yadav |url=https://www.deccanchronicle.com/150703/entertainment-kollywood/article/kissing-scene-didn%E2%80%99t-need-36-retakes-manisha-yadav |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150704074407/http://www.deccanchronicle.com/150703/entertainment-kollywood/article/kissing-scene-didn%E2%80%99t-need-36-retakes-manisha-yadav |archive-date=4 July 2015 |access-date=26 July 2015 |website=[[Deccan Chronicle]]}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |date=4 July 2015 |title=When actor GV Prakash Kumar kissed Manisha Yadav 36 times |url=http://www.hindustantimes.com/regional/trisha-illana-nayanthara-s-lip-lock-scene-took-36-takes/article1-1365587.aspx |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150704080627/http://www.hindustantimes.com/regional/trisha-illana-nayanthara-s-lip-lock-scene-took-36-takes/article1-1365587.aspx |archive-date=4 July 2015 |access-date=26 July 2015 |website=[[Hindustan Times]] |agency=[[Indo-Asian News Service|IANS]]}}</ref> with [[VTV Ganesh]] and [[Simran (actress)|Simran]] portraying supporting roles.<ref>{{Cite web |title=First Look: 'Trisha Illana Nayanthara' |url=http://www.sify.com/movies/first-look--trisha-illana-nayanthara-imagegallery-kollywood-pc2qTnjecihcb.html |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150420013113/http://www.sify.com/movies/first-look--trisha-illana-nayanthara-imagegallery-kollywood-pc2qTnjecihcb.html |archive-date=20 April 2015 |access-date=4 June 2015 |website=[[Sify]]}}</ref> The film was released on 17 September 2015.


==Plot==
==Plot==
Line 107: Line 107:


== Critical reception ==
== Critical reception ==
[[Baradwaj Rangan]] from ''[[The Hindu]]'' wrote, "Where the director really chickens out is in not pushing his 'A' rating far enough. At a time when films claim they are made for 'family audiences' despite having the worst innuendos, here's someone being honest — he's saying his film is strictly for adults. But why, then, waste so much time on songs and a soggy romantic subplot...? After all, you've pretty much torched Thamizh kalaacharam with your heroines — why not gross us out all the way? But I wouldn't write Adhik Ravichandran off. He has a good ear for laugh-out-loud dialogue and a good eye for the absurd."<ref>{{Cite news |last=Rangan |first=Baradwaj |author-link=Baradwaj Rangan |date=19 September 2015 |title=An okayish sex comedy where the joke is on the hero |url=https://www.thehindu.com/news/national/tamil-nadu/an-okayish-sex-comedy-where-the-joke-is-on-the-hero/article7669738.ece |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240503053130/https://www.thehindu.com/news/national/tamil-nadu/an-okayish-sex-comedy-where-the-joke-is-on-the-hero/article7669738.ece |archive-date=3 May 2024 |access-date=3 May 2024 |work=[[The Hindu]] |language=en}}</ref> Similarly, ''[[Indo-Asian News Service]]'' wrote, "''Trisha Illana Nayanthara'' was promoted as the boldest Tamil film of this generation, and as strictly intended for adults. It's bold to an extent, but not quite enough and that's disappointing, considering it was Tamil cinema's first attempt at the genre and I wish they had gone all the way" and that "Adhik is a filmmaker you can't easily write off."<ref>{{Cite web |date=18 September 2015 |title='Trisha Illana Nayanthara' review: A fun sex comedy that isn't bold enough |url=http://economictimes.indiatimes.com/magazines/panache/trisha-illana-nayanthara-review-a-fun-sex-comedy-that-isnt-bold-enough/articleshow/49012952.cms |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20161106012441/http://economictimes.indiatimes.com/magazines/panache/trisha-illana-nayanthara-review-a-fun-sex-comedy-that-isnt-bold-enough/articleshow/49012952.cms |archive-date=6 November 2016 |access-date=23 September 2015 |website=[[The Economic Times]] |agency=[[IANS]]}}</ref> ''[[The Times of India]]'' gave 3 stars out of 5 and wrote, "There are innumerable innuendos...and adult comedy...and misogynist dialogues, but they do not come across as exploitative but rather harmless fun. And the film also has moments of genuine absurdity...that prove us that the director clearly knows what he is doing."<ref>{{Cite news |last=Suganth |first=M |date=19 September 2015 |title=Trisha Illana Nayanthara Movie Review |url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/tamil/movie-reviews/Trisha-Illana-Nayanthara/movie-review/49021609.cms |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150923014658/http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/tamil/movie-reviews/Trisha-Illana-Nayanthara/movie-review/49021609.cms |archive-date=23 September 2015 |access-date=23 September 2015 |work=[[The Times of India]]}}</ref> ''[[Sify]]'' wrote, "''Trisha Illana Nayanthara'' is uninhibited and naughty which has enough frenzied moments to keep the youth audiences in splits."<ref>{{Cite web |title=Trisha Illana Nayanthara |url=http://www.sify.com/movies/trisha-illana-nayanthara-review--pjrrISchgeije.html |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150919003843/http://www.sify.com/movies/trisha-illana-nayanthara-review--pjrrISchgeije.html |archive-date=19 September 2015 |access-date=23 September 2015 |website=[[Sify]]}}</ref> ''[[Rediff.com]]'' gave 2 stars out of 5 and wrote, "Director Adhik Ravichandran's ''Trisha Illana Nayanthara'' is no sensitive coming-of-age film, but rather a prejudiced portrayal of modern day youngsters discovering their sexuality."<ref>{{Cite web |last=Saraswathi |first=S. |date=18 September 2015 |title=Review: Trisha Illana Nayanthara is a bold film |url=http://www.rediff.com/movies/review/review-trisha-illana-nayanthara-is-a-bold-film/20150918.htm |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150923183046/http://www.rediff.com/movies/review/review-trisha-illana-nayanthara-is-a-bold-film/20150918.htm |archive-date=23 September 2015 |access-date=30 November 2015 |website=[[Rediff.com]] |language=en}}</ref>
[[Baradwaj Rangan]] from ''[[The Hindu]]'' wrote, "Where the director really chickens out is in not pushing his 'A' rating far enough. ==Biography==
==Biography==
D. P. Kraniotis (b. 15 July 1966) <ref>[https://poets.gr/en/poets/kraniotis-p-dimitris Poets.gr]</ref><ref>[http://www.ekebi.gr/frontoffice/portal.asp?cpage=NODE&cnode=462&t=3909 National Book Centre of Greece]</ref> was born in Larissa prefecture in central Greece and grew up in Stomio (Larissa). He studied at the Medical School of the Aristotle University in Thessaloniki (Greece). He lives and works as internal medicine specialist physician in Larissa (Greece).
D. P. Kraniotis (b. 15 July 1966) <ref>[https://poets.gr/en/poets/kraniotis-p-dimitris Poets.gr]</ref><ref>[http://www.ekebi.gr/frontoffice/portal.asp?cpage=NODE&cnode=462&t=3909 National Book Centre of Greece]</ref> was born in Larissa prefecture in central Greece and grew up in Stomio (Larissa). He studied at the Medical School of the Aristotle University in Thessaloniki (Greece) and obtained a Master of Science (MSc) in Medicine at the University of Thessaly (Greece). He lives and works as internal medicine specialist physician in Larissa (Greece).


He is the author<ref>[http://id.loc.gov/authorities/names/no2018170057.html Library of Congress, Washington DC, USA]</ref><ref>[https://viaf.org/viaf/164139904/ VIAF]</ref><ref>[http://worldcat.org/identities/viaf-164139904/ WorldCat Identities]</ref> of 11 poetry books in 7 languages (Greek, English, French, Romanian, Albanian, Italian, Spanish) and the Editor-in-chief of an international anthology in English (205 poets from 65 countries).
He is the author<ref>[http://id.loc.gov/authorities/names/no2018170057.html Library of Congress, Washington DC, USA]</ref><ref>[https://viaf.org/viaf/164139904/ VIAF]</ref><ref>[http://worldcat.org/identities/viaf-164139904/ WorldCat Identities]</ref> of 11 poetry books in 7 languages (Greek, English, French, Romanian, Albanian, Italian, Spanish) and the Editor-in-chief of an international anthology in English (205 poets from 65 countries).


He has participated in several International Poetry Festivals.<ref>[https://www.festivaldepoesiademedellin.org/es/Festival/32/DimitrisKraniotis/ Medellin International Poetry Festival, Medellin, Colombia]</ref><ref>[https://2018.orpheus-plovdiv.eu/en/participants/23-dimitris-p-kraniotis-greece-димитрис-п-краниотис-гърция International Poetry Festival Orpheus, Plovdiv, Bulgaria]</ref><ref>[https://svp.org.mk/en/poet/dimitris-p-kraniotis Struga Poetry Evenings, Struga, North Macedonia]</ref> His poetry has been translated into 38 languages (English,<ref>[https://trove.nla.gov.au/work/26990413 The world's changing faces], Poetry Now, UK, 2005, {{ISBN|1-84602-032-8}}, National Library of Australia</ref><ref>[https://trove.nla.gov.au/work/32124143 Whispers in the wind], Poetry Now, UK, 2005, {{ISBN|1-84602-031-X}}, National Library of Australia</ref><ref>[https://trove.nla.gov.au/work/20487516 Free-falling - a collection of free verse from Poetry Now], Poetry Now, UK, 2006, {{ISBN|1-84602-033-6}}, National Library of Australia</ref><ref>[https://www.cyberwit.net/publications/36 Harvests of New Millennium], Cyberwit.net, India, 2005, {{ISBN|81-8253-050-4}}</ref><ref>[https://www.odyssey.pm/contributors/dimitris-kraniotis/ Odyssey.pm (Mediterranean Poetry)]</ref><ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.arabesques-editions.com/journal/contributors/dimitris_p_kraniotis.html |title=Arabesques Review, Algeria |access-date=2019-02-13 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131114003411/http://www.arabesques-editions.com/journal/contributors/dimitris_p_kraniotis.html |archive-date=2013-11-14 |url-status=dead }}</ref><ref>[http://www.cannonpoets.org.uk/TCMIndex_to_Issue_64_June_2017.pdf "The Cannon’s Mouth" magazine, UK, 2006]</ref> French,<ref>[https://www.lemanoirdespoetes.fr/poemes-dimitris-kraniotis.php Le Manoir des poètes, France]</ref><ref>[http://www.grecehebdo.gr/index.php/culture/romans-poesie/2118-po%C3%A9sie-dimitris-p-kraniotis,-moins-un GrèceHebdo]</ref> Polish,<ref>[http://miesiecznik.uz.zgora.pl/wydawnictwo/miesiecznik04-2014/35.pdf "Miesiecznik Społecznosci Akademickiej" magazine, University of Zielona Góra, Poland]</ref> Czech,<ref>[https://www.ceskatelevize.cz/porady/10318557365-evropa-jedna-basen/311295350190013-evropa-jedna-basen-dimitris-p-kraniotis/ Česká televize, Czech Republic]</ref> Spanish,<ref>[http://www.fabiolentini.it/elogio_de_la_palabra_2008_progetto.pdf Elogio de la palabra], I.E.S. Albero, Seville, Spain, 2008, {{ISBN|978-84-608-0738-4}}</ref><ref>[http://www.sur-revista-de-literatura.com/Creaciones09/DIMITRISPoemas.pdf "Sur. Revista de Literatura" magazine, Málaga, Spain]</ref> Turkish,<ref>[https://issuu.com/conversationpoetry/docs/volume_1 "Söyleşi Üç Aylık Şiir Dergisi" magazine, Turkey]</ref> Bulgarian,<ref>[https://orpheus-plovdiv.eu/books/orpheus-plovdiv2018_book-1.pdf International Poetry Festival Orpheus, Plovdiv, Bulgaria]{{Dead link|date=October 2022 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref> Romanian, Italian, Albanian, Arabic, Serbian, Dutch, Portuguese, Russian, Chinese, Japanese, German, Slovak, Macedonian, [[Persian language|Persian]], Bengali, Kurdish, Vietnamese, Gujarati, Kazakh, Tamil, Danish, Swahili, Hebrew, Uzbek, Hungarian, Estonian, Ukrainian, Korean, Tajik, Hindi and Azerbaijani) and published in many countries around the World.
He has participated in several International Poetry Festivals.<ref>[https://www.festivaldepoesiademedellin.org/es/Festival/32/DimitrisKraniotis/ Medellin International Poetry Festival, Medellin, Colombia]</ref><ref>[https://2018.orpheus-plovdiv.eu/en/participants/23-dimitris-p-kraniotis-greece-димитрис-п-краниотис-гърция International Poetry Festival Orpheus, Plovdiv, Bulgaria]</ref><ref>[https://svp.org.mk/en/poet/dimitris-p-kraniotis Struga Poetry Evenings, Struga, North Macedonia]</ref> His poetry has been translated into 40 languages (English,<ref>[https://trove.nla.gov.au/work/26990413 The world's changing faces], Poetry Now, UK, 2005, {{ISBN|1-84602-032-8}}, National Library of Australia</ref><ref>[https://trove.nla.gov.au/work/32124143 Whispers in the wind], Poetry Now, UK, 2005, {{ISBN|1-84602-031-X}}, National Library of Australia</ref><ref>[https://trove.nla.gov.au/work/20487516 Free-falling - a collection of free verse from Poetry Now], Poetry Now, UK, 2006, {{ISBN|1-84602-033-6}}, National Library of Australia</ref><ref>[https://www.cyberwit.net/publications/36 Harvests of New Millennium], Cyberwit.net, India, 2005, {{ISBN|81-8253-050-4}}</ref><ref>[https://www.odyssey.pm/contributors/dimitris-kraniotis/ Odyssey.pm (Mediterranean Poetry)]</ref><ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.arabesques-editions.com/journal/contributors/dimitris_p_kraniotis.html |title=Arabesques Review, Algeria |access-date=2019-02-13 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131114003411/http://www.arabesques-editions.com/journal/contributors/dimitris_p_kraniotis.html |archive-date=2013-11-14 |url-status=dead }}</ref><ref>[http://www.cannonpoets.org.uk/TCMIndex_to_Issue_64_June_2017.pdf "The Cannon’s Mouth" magazine, UK, 2006]</ref> French,<ref>[https://www.lemanoirdespoetes.fr/poemes-dimitris-kraniotis.php Le Manoir des poètes, France]</ref><ref>[http://www.grecehebdo.gr/index.php/culture/romans-poesie/2118-po%C3%A9sie-dimitris-p-kraniotis,-moins-un GrèceHebdo]</ref> Polish,<ref>[http://miesiecznik.uz.zgora.pl/wydawnictwo/miesiecznik04-2014/35.pdf "Miesiecznik Społecznosci Akademickiej" magazine, University of Zielona Góra, Poland]</ref> Czech,<ref>[https://www.ceskatelevize.cz/porady/10318557365-evropa-jedna-basen/311295350190013-evropa-jedna-basen-dimitris-p-kraniotis/ Česká televize, Czech Republic]</ref> Spanish,<ref>[http://www.fabiolentini.it/elogio_de_la_palabra_2008_progetto.pdf Elogio de la palabra], I.E.S. Albero, Seville, Spain, 2008, {{ISBN|978-84-608-0738-4}}</ref><ref>[http://www.sur-revista-de-literatura.com/Creaciones09/DIMITRISPoemas.pdf "Sur. Revista de Literatura" magazine, Málaga, Spain]</ref> Turkish,<ref>[https://issuu.com/conversationpoetry/docs/volume_1 "Söyleşi Üç Aylık Şiir Dergisi" magazine, Turkey]</ref> Bulgarian,<ref>[https://orpheus-plovdiv.eu/books/orpheus-plovdiv2018_book-1.pdf International Poetry Festival Orpheus, Plovdiv, Bulgaria]{{Dead link|date=October 2022 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref> Romanian, Italian, Albanian, Arabic, Serbian, Dutch, Portuguese, Russian, Chinese, Japanese, German, Slovak, Macedonian, [[Persian language|Persian]], Bengali, Kurdish, Vietnamese, Gujarati, Kazakh, Tamil, Danish, Swahili, Hebrew, Uzbek, Hungarian, Estonian, Ukrainian, Korean, Tajik, Hindi, Azerbaijani, Yoruba and Armenian) and published in many countries around the World.


In 2011 the 22nd World Congress of Poets took place in Larissa, Greece.<ref>[https://www.upli-wcp.org/world_congress/wcp-history.html United Poets Laureate International]</ref> with D. P. Kraniotis as president. He also founded the 1st Mediterranean Poetry Festival in Larissa. He is member of several literary organizations (National Society of Greek Literary Writers, Hellenic Literary Society, Hellenic Society of Writing Physicians, World Poetry Movement, Poets of the Planet,<ref>[https://poetsoftheplanet.com/kraniotis-dimitris-p/ Poets of the Planet]</ref> World Poets Society, United Poets Laureate International, Poetas del Mundo, etc.). Also, he is Chairman of the Writers for Peace Committee of PEN Greece <ref>[https://pen-greece.org/en/melh-pen-greece/dimitris-p-kraniotis/ PEN Greece]</ref> and editor of the Greek poetry magazine "Poetics @ GR" (Τετράδιο Ποίησης).<ref>[http://greekpoetics.blogspot.com/ "Poetics @ GR" (Τετράδιο Ποίησης)]</ref>
In 2011 the 22nd World Congress of Poets took place in Larissa, Greece.<ref>[https://www.upli-wcp.org/world_congress/wcp-history.html United Poets Laureate International]</ref> with D. P. Kraniotis as president. He also founded the 1st Mediterranean Poetry Festival in Larissa. He is member of several literary organizations (National Society of Greek Literary Writers, Hellenic Literary Society, Hellenic Society of Writing Physicians, World Poetry Movement, Poets of the Planet,<ref>[https://poetsoftheplanet.com/kraniotis-dimitris-p/ Poets of the Planet]</ref> World Poets Society, United Poets Laureate International, Poetas del Mundo, etc.). Also, he is Chairman of the Writers for Peace Committee of PEN Greece <ref>[https://pen-greece.org/en/melh-pen-greece/dimitris-p-kraniotis/ PEN Greece]</ref> and editor of the Greek poetry magazine "Poetics @ GR" (Τετράδιο Ποίησης).<ref>[http://greekpoetics.blogspot.com/ "Poetics @ GR" (Τετράδιο Ποίησης)]</ref>

Villa in the Premiership

← Previous revision Revision as of 10:58, 8 February 2026
Line 46: Line 46:
The [[1990–91 in English football|1990–91 season]] was Vengloš's only season as manager of Aston Villa. Their second-place finish the previous season earned them qualification for the [[1990–91 UEFA Cup|UEFA Cup]] as one of the first English clubs to enter European competition after the ban resulting from the [[Heysel Stadium disaster]] was lifted.<ref name="ward156">Ward, p. 156</ref> They beat first round opponents [[FC Baník Ostrava|Baník Ostrava]] over two legs, and won the first leg of the second round tie against [[Inter Milan]]. However, this lead was overturned by Inter in the return leg 3–0 and Villa were eliminated.<ref name="ward156"/> The defeat started a decline, and by the end of the season they were two places above the relegation zone. Vengloš stepped down and David Platt was sold to Italian side [[A.S. Bari|Bari]] for £5 million. The team's new manager was [[Ron Atkinson]], who had taken [[West Bromwich Albion F.C.|West Bromwich Albion]] to the quarter-finals of the UEFA Cup and had won the League Cup with [[Sheffield Wednesday F.C.|Sheffield Wednesday]]. In his first season in charge, [[1991–92 in English football|1991–92]], Villa finished in sixth place and thus became one of the founder members of the [[FA Premier League]].<ref>Ward, Adam, p. 161</ref>
The [[1990–91 in English football|1990–91 season]] was Vengloš's only season as manager of Aston Villa. Their second-place finish the previous season earned them qualification for the [[1990–91 UEFA Cup|UEFA Cup]] as one of the first English clubs to enter European competition after the ban resulting from the [[Heysel Stadium disaster]] was lifted.<ref name="ward156">Ward, p. 156</ref> They beat first round opponents [[FC Baník Ostrava|Baník Ostrava]] over two legs, and won the first leg of the second round tie against [[Inter Milan]]. However, this lead was overturned by Inter in the return leg 3–0 and Villa were eliminated.<ref name="ward156"/> The defeat started a decline, and by the end of the season they were two places above the relegation zone. Vengloš stepped down and David Platt was sold to Italian side [[A.S. Bari|Bari]] for £5 million. The team's new manager was [[Ron Atkinson]], who had taken [[West Bromwich Albion F.C.|West Bromwich Albion]] to the quarter-finals of the UEFA Cup and had won the League Cup with [[Sheffield Wednesday F.C.|Sheffield Wednesday]]. In his first season in charge, [[1991–92 in English football|1991–92]], Villa finished in sixth place and thus became one of the founder members of the [[FA Premier League]].<ref>Ward, Adam, p. 161</ref>


==Villa in the Premiership==
==Villa in the Premier League==
[[Image:Holte.jpg|thumb|left|The Holte End was converted into an all-seater stand in 1994.]]
[[Image:Holte.jpg|thumb|left|The Holte End was converted into an all-seater stand in 1994.]]
In his first 18 months in charge, Atkinson bought [[Earl Barrett]], [[Dean Saunders]], [[Andy Townsend]], [[Dalian Atkinson]], [[Kevin Richardson (footballer)|Kevin Richardson]], [[Ray Houghton]] and [[Shaun Teale]]. They helped the club to finish as runners-up to Manchester United in the inaugural [[Premier League]] season of [[1992–93 FA Premier League|1992–93]]. The strike partnership of Saunders and Atkinson established itself as one of the most successful partnerships in the Premiership.<ref>Ward, Adam, p. 162</ref> On 27 March 1994 Villa won the [[1994 Football League Cup Final|League Cup final]] 3–1, to secure a second successive UEFA Cup campaign, although their Premier League form dipped and they finished 10th. At the end of the [[1993–94 in English football|1993–94 season]], they played their last game at a [[terrace (stadium)|terraced]] [[Villa Park]] before it was converted over the summer to an [[all-seater stadium]] to comply with the [[Taylor Report]].<ref>Ward, Adam, pp. 165–166</ref> In November 1994, Atkinson was dismissed following a poor start to the season.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.birminghammail.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/aston-villa-ron-atkinson-sacked-8084886 |title=The in-depth story of how Big Ron's swaggering Aston Villa adventure came to an end |work=[[Birmingham Mail]] |last=Kendrick |first=Mat |date=19 March 2018 |access-date=8 December 2019}}</ref>

They helped the club to finish as runners-up to Manchester United in the inaugural [[Premier League]] season of [[1992–93 FA Premier League|1992–93]]. The strike partnership of Saunders and Atkinson established itself as one of the most successful partnerships in the Premiership.<ref>Ward, Adam, p. 162</ref> On 27 March 1994 Villa won the [[1994 Football League Cup Final|League Cup final]] 3–1, to secure a second successive UEFA Cup campaign, although their Premier League form dipped and they finished 10th. At the end of the [[1993–94 in English football|1993–94 season]], they played their last game at a [[terrace (stadium)|terraced]] [[Villa Park]] before it was converted over the summer to an [[all-seater stadium]] to comply with the [[Taylor Report]].<ref>Ward, Adam, pp. 165–166</ref> In November 1994, Atkinson was dismissed following a poor start to the season.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.birminghammail.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/aston-villa-ron-atkinson-sacked-8084886 |title=The in-depth story of how Big Ron's swaggering Aston Villa adventure came to an end |work=[[Birmingham Mail]] |last=Kendrick |first=Mat |date=19 March 2018 |access-date=8 December 2019}}</ref>

The '''Battle of Khasauka''' (Battle of the Khasauka Pass, Battle of Mount Khasauka, Karach-Balk.-Khasauka Urush) was a battle during the [[Caucasian War]] between the Russian imperial troops and the [[Karachays|Karachay]] militia, which took place from 17 October (29 October) till 29 October (10 November), 1828 near the village of Kart-Dzhurt. It ended with the defeat of the mountaineers, but Karachay would remain independent until the formal annexation of Karachay to the [[Russian Empire]] in 1834.<ref>{{Cite web |title=The accession of the Karachay territory to thе Russian Empire in 1828 |url=https://www.gsen.sfedu.ru/pdf/2015/05/002-eng.pdf}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |title=Chronology of Wars in the Contemporary Age: Third Decade of the 19th Century, p. 16. |url=http://www.magatem.com.ar/CRONOLOGIA-DE-LAS-GUERRAS-EN-LA-EDAD-CONTEMPORANEA-TERCERA-DECADA-DEL-SIGLO-XIX.pdf}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |title=Susana Noemí Tomasi, World Economic History: The Relationship Between Economic Crises and Wars, Volume VIII: In the Contemporary Age, Chapter VII - Third Decade of the 19th Century, p. 361. |url=https://magatem.com.ar/LA-RELACION-ENTRE-LAS-CRISIS-ECONOMICAS-Y-LAS-GUERRAS-TOMO%20VIII-EN-LA-EDAD-CONTEMPORANEA-CAPITULO-VII-TERCERA-DECADA-DEL-SIGLO-XIX.pdf}}</ref>

It ended with the defeat of the mountaineers, but Karachay would remain independent until the formal annexation of Karachay to the [[Russian Empire]] in 1834.<ref>{{Cite web |title=The accession of the Karachay territory to thе Russian Empire in 1828 |url=https://www.gsen.sfedu.ru/pdf/2015/05/002-eng.pdf}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |title=Chronology of Wars in the Contemporary Age: Third Decade of the 19th Century, p. 16. |url=http://www.magatem.com.ar/CRONOLOGIA-DE-LAS-GUERRAS-EN-LA-EDAD-CONTEMPORANEA-TERCERA-DECADA-DEL-SIGLO-XIX.pdf}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |title=Susana Noemí Tomasi, World Economic History: The Relationship Between Economic Crises and Wars, Volume VIII: In the Contemporary Age, Chapter VII - Third Decade of the 19th Century, p. 361. |url=https://magatem.com.ar/LA-RELACION-ENTRE-LAS-CRISIS-ECONOMICAS-Y-LAS-GUERRAS-TOMO%20VIII-EN-LA-EDAD-CONTEMPORANEA-CAPITULO-VII-TERCERA-DECADA-DEL-SIGLO-XIX.pdf}}</ref>


==Background==
==Background==

After the conquest of [[Kabardia|Kabarda]] and the annexation of [[Balkars|Balkaria]] to the Russian Empire, a number of gorges in Balkaria and Karachay remained refuges for Kabardian, Karachay, Balkar and other mountain detachments that continued resistance to the Russian administration.<ref>{{Cite web |title=1827 January 11. - Appeal of the Balkar and Ossetian elders |url=https://www.vostlit.info/Texts/Dokumenty/Kavkaz/XIX/1820-1840/Probl_kavk_vojny/1-20/1.htm |archive-url= |access-date=2024-06-25 |website=}}</ref>

In 1826, Mohammed (Amantish) Dudov fled from Karachay, who subsequently, on the eve of Emmanuel's campaign in Karachay, was in [[Nalchik]]. Due to disagreements with Oliy Islam Krymshamkhalov, Dudov agreed to cooperate with the Russians and gave important information about the approaches to Karachay and acted as a guide for Russian troops.<ref name=":0" /><ref>{{Cite web |title=KARACHAY AND BALKARIA IN THE RUSSIAN-CAUCASIAN WAR - Barazbiev M.I. - History - Articles - Karachay and Balkars |url=https://karachai.ucoz.ru/publ/ist/istorija/karachaj_i_balkarija_v_russko_kavkazskoj_vojne/10-1-0-7 |access-date=2024-06-25 |website=karachai.ucoz.ru}}</ref>

Due to disagreements with Oliy Islam Krymshamkhalov, Dudov agreed to cooperate with the Russians and gave important information about the approaches to Karachay and acted as a guide for Russian troops.<ref name=":0" /><ref>{{Cite web |title=KARACHAY AND BALKARIA IN THE RUSSIAN-CAUCASIAN WAR - Barazbiev M.I. - History - Articles - Karachay and Balkars |url=https://karachai.ucoz.ru/publ/ist/istorija/karachaj_i_balkarija_v_russko_kavkazskoj_vojne/10-1-0-7 |access-date=2024-06-25 |website=karachai.ucoz.ru}}</ref>
Line 64: Line 64:
General Emmanuel himself was with the first column. In addition, Major General Antropov was ordered with a small detachment allocated from the Kuban reserves to go to another "Stone Bridge", in Kuban, and cover the columns; another detachment of hundreds of Khopers, 2 companies of infantry, and 2 guns, located in the Ukrainian. Ust-Dzhegutinsky, under the command of Major Romashev, was ordered to join Lukovkin's column and take part in the campaign against the Karachais.<ref name=":1" />

Ust-Dzhegutinsky, under the command of Major Romashev, was ordered to join Lukovkin's column and take part in the campaign against the Karachais.<ref name=":1" />


The route was chosen thanks to Emmanuel's guides, Magomet Dudov, and the Abaza prisoner, assimilated by the Kabardians, Atazhuko Abukov, the latter was often, but erroneously, identified with the Kabardian prince Atajuko Atazhukin.<ref>Z.B. Kipkeeva. Descendants of Genghis Khan in the history of the North Caucasus of the XVIII-XIX centuries. - Stavropol, 2017. - S. 178-179. - {{ISBN|978-5-9296-0891-9}}</ref>

Kipkeeva. Descendants of Genghis Khan in the history of the North Caucasus of the XVIII-XIX centuries. - Stavropol, 2017. - S. 178-179. - {{ISBN|978-5-9296-0891-9}}</ref>


On 20 October (1 November), 1828, Russian troops began the approach to the pass near Mount Khasauka near the village of Kart-Dzhurt, where at the foot of the mountain they were met by troops of the Karachay people's militia. In the vanguard of the Russians, under the command of Major Verzilin, followed a hundred Khoper Cossacks, 80 people of the Volga Cossacks, a company of Navagintsev and 100 riflemen of the Tenginsky regiment, one horse gun and two kegorn mortars, the rest of the infantry moved behind the vanguard, with the Cossacks in the tail; the rearguard consisted of 30 infantry and 30 Cossacks. When climbing Mount Khotsekoy, the Karachais met the vanguard with strong fire, trying to delay its movement. After an hour and a half bayonet battle, the mountain was captured.

Chernyshev, about the negotiations of Prince I.V. Shakhovsky with the Karachais, "on the resumption oath of allegiance to Russia":<ref>Socio-economic, political and cultural development of the peoples of Karachay-Cherkessia. 1790-1917. Collection of documents. - Rostov-on-Don, 1985. - p. 48-49.</ref>


Due to their position, the Karachais can contribute very much to ensuring the peace of the surroundings of [[Mineral water|Mineral Waters]] and [[Kabardia|Kabarda]], in order to convince them of this, I allowed the staff captain, Prince Shakhovsky, to promise them that their former amanates will be returned if they again submit to the conditions that are beneficial to us conditions...During the ongoing negotiations between Prince Shakhovsky and the elders, this Karachay people proved by experience their zeal and the benefits that can be expected from their sincere devotion. A party of predators, having crossed the Kuban, stole 6 rams and 60 cattle from Kabarda and carried away three boys into captivity; the most honorable of the elders of the Karachays, the seventy-year-old old man Krymshamkhalov with 30 of his people rushed in pursuit, caught up with the predators and, despite the fact that there were 140 of them, stopped and held until he received reinforcements from the people, then, having recaptured all the prey from them, returned to the [[Kabardians]] according to their ownership.
Due to their position, the Karachais can contribute very much to ensuring the peace of the surroundings of [[Mineral water|Mineral Waters]] and [[Kabardia]], in order to convince them of this, I allowed the staff captain, Prince Shakhovsky, to promise them that their former amanates will be returned if they again submit to the conditions that are beneficial to us conditions...During the ongoing negotiations between Prince Shakhovsky and the elders, this Karachay people proved by experience their zeal and the benefits that can be expected from their sincere devotion. A party of predators, having crossed the Kuban, stole 6 rams and 60 cattle from Kabardia and carried away three boys into captivity; the most honorable of the elders of the Karachays, the seventy-year-old old man Krymshamkhalov with 30 of his people rushed in pursuit, caught up with the predators and, despite the fact that there were 140 of them, stopped and held until he received reinforcements from the people, then, having recaptured all the prey from them, returned to the [[Kabardians]] according to their ownership.


==Folklore==
==Folklore==
The Battle of Khasauka has been memorialized in [[Karachays|Karachay]] and [[Balkars|Balkar]] folklore, with songs and oral traditions preserving the memory of the Karachay warriors who fought in the battle. Songs such as "Khasauqa" and "Song of Umar" celebrate the bravery and sacrifice of those who resisted [[Russian conquest of the Caucasus|Russian conquest]]. These cultural expressions have helped maintain a sense of identity and resistance among the Karachay people, even as they became part of the [[Russian Empire]].

Line 229: Line 229:
England's only major tournament for most of history prior to 1995, England's only tournament was the [[Rugby League European Championship]], in which they developed rivalries with [[Wales national rugby league team|Wales]] and [[France national rugby league team|France]]. Since then, England has inherited Great Britain's rivalries, primarily with [[Australia national rugby league team|Australia]] (to whom they now contest [[Men's rugby league Ashes|The Ashes]] instead of Great Britain) as well [[New Zealand national rugby league team|New Zealand]].
England's only major tournament for most of history prior to 1995, England's only tournament was the [[Rugby League European Championship]], in which they developed rivalries with [[Wales national rugby league team|Wales]] and [[France national rugby league team|France]]. Since then, England has inherited Great Britain's rivalries, primarily with [[Australia national rugby league team|Australia]] (to whom they now contest [[Men's rugby league Ashes|The Ashes]] instead of Great Britain) as well [[New Zealand national rugby league team|New Zealand]].


Traditionally a predominantly white kit is worn including white shorts and socks. However the shirt usually features some form of red, like red stripes, crosses or chevrons. These colours are similar to other English sporting teams and are the colours used on the national flag. In 2008 a new kit was introduced featuring a red cross on the front and red strips down the sides of the shirt, shorts and socks were white too with red strips.<ref>[http://www.englandrl.co.uk/article.php?id=10801 England Official Website – New Shirt Launched] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120211200521/http://www.englandrl.co.uk/article.php?id=10801 |date=11 February 2012 }} Retrieved on 18 June 2008.</ref> In 2008, the Rugby Football League chose to abandon the traditional English lion on the badge in favour of a much simpler shield and [[Saint George's Cross<ref></ref>]] design,<ref>[http://www.englandrl.co.uk/article.php?id=9550 England Official Website – New Logo] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120211200532/http://www.englandrl.co.uk/article.php?id=9550 |date=11 February 2012 }} Retrieved on 18 June 2008.</ref> nevertheless the team will still be known as "The Lions".

As of September 2024 the team is ranked third in the world, behind [[Australia national rugby league team|Australia]] and [[New Zealand national rugby league team|New Zealand]].<ref>{{cite web |title=IRL - World rankings |url=https://www.intrl.sport/world-rankings |publisher=International Rugby League |access-date=18 September 2024}}</ref> [[Shaun Wane]] is head coach and [[George Williams (rugby league, born 1994)|George Williams]] is the current captain.

California Hardware Company was a wholesale [[Hardware store|hardware]] distributor based in the Los Angeles area. Business began 1892 and lasted well over 120 years until 2012. At its zenith it was the largest supplier of hardware, housewares, tools, plumbing and electrical supplies west of the Mississippi. Its customers were hardware dealers, lumberyards and home centers in California, Nevada, Oregon and Arizona. At the height of its business, the company operated a 400,000 square foot warehouse and office employing 260 workers.<ref name=":0" />

Its customers were hardware dealers, lumberyards and home centers in California, Nevada, Oregon and Arizona. At the height of its business, the company operated a 400,000 square foot warehouse and office employing 260 workers.<ref name=":0" />

In January, tens of thousands of teachers and school staff took to the streets of Lisbon to protest for higher wages and better working conditions, marking one of the largest demonstrations in recent years.<ref>{{Cite news |last1=Demony |first1=Catarina |last2=Pereira |first2=Miguel |last3=Demony |first3=Catarina |date=2023-01-14 |title=Thousands of teachers take to Lisbon streets to demand higher wages |url=https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/thousands-teachers-take-lisbon-streets-demand-higher-wages-2023-01-14/ |access-date=2025-09-13 |work=Reuters |language=en}}</ref> This was part of an ongoing wave of discontent among [[public sector]] employees, including doctors, nurses, and [[Civil service|civil servants]], who staged walk-outs to demand wage increases.<ref name=":0">{{Cite web |title=Portugal's public sector workers strike over pay amid inflation |url=https://www.aljazeera.com/economy/2022/11/18/portugals-public-sector-workers-strike-over-pay-amid-inflation |access-date=2025-09-13 |website=Al Jazeera |language=en}}</ref>
In January tens of thousands of teachers and school staff took to the streets of Lisbon to protest for higher wages and better working conditions, marking one of the largest demonstrations in recent years.<ref>{{Cite news |last1=Demony |first1=Catarina |last2=Pereira |first2=Miguel |last3=Demony |first3=Catarina |date=2023-01-14 |title=Thousands of teachers take to Lisbon streets to demand higher wages |url=https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/thousands-teachers-take-lisbon-streets-demand-higher-wages-2023-01-14/ |access-date=2025-09-13 |work=Reuters |language=en}}</ref> This was part of an ongoing wave of discontent among [[public sector]] employees, including doctors, nurses, and civil servants, who staged walk-outs to demand wage increases.<ref name=":0">{{Cite web |title=Portugal's public sector workers strike over pay amid inflation |url=https://www.aljazeera.com/economy/2022/11/18/portugals-public-sector-workers-strike-over-pay-amid-inflation |access-date=2025-09-13 |website=Al Jazeera |language=en}}</ref>


The strike actions led to significant service disruptions nationwide. Many schools and courts were shut down, hospital appointments and surgeries were canceled, and [[Waste collection|garbage collection services]] were halted.<ref name=":0" />
The strike actions led to significant service disruptions nationwide. Many schools and courts were shut down, hospital appointments and surgeries were canceled, and garbage-collection services were halted.<ref name=":0" />


== Reaction ==
== Reaction ==
The [[Government of Portugal|Portuguese government]] responded to the strikes with a combination of public appeals and legislative measures. Prime Minister [[António Costa]], facing increasing pressure, resigned in November 2023 amid a corruption investigation involving several government officials.<ref>{{Cite news |last=Jones |first=Sam |date=2023-11-07 |title=Portuguese PM António Costa resigns amid corruption inquiry |url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/nov/07/portuguese-pm-antonio-costa-resigns-amid-corruption-inquiry |access-date=2025-09-13 |work=The Guardian |language=en-GB |issn=0261-3077}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |date=2023-11-07 |title=Portugal's prime minister resigns as his government is involved in a corruption investigation |url=https://apnews.com/article/portugal-corruption-arrests-costa-935d9f33c9e5179e920dc7e1bcd95eea |access-date=2025-09-13 |website=AP News |language=en}}</ref> Subsequently, the [[Socialist Party (Portugal)|Socialist Party]] held a [[2023 Portuguese Socialist Party leadership election|leadership election]] in December 2023, resulting in [[Pedro Nuno Santos]] becoming the new [[Secretary (title)|Secretary-General]].<ref>{{Cite web |title=PS vai escolher o próximo secretário-geral a 15 e 16 de dezembro. Congresso marcado para 6 e 7 de janeiro |url=https://cnnportugal.iol.pt/partido-socialista/congresso/ps-vai-escolher-o-proximo-secretario-geral-a-15-e-16-de-dezembro-congresso-marcado-para-6-e-7-de-janeiro/20231110/654d77f8d34e371fc0b9b434 |access-date=2025-09-13 |website=CNN Portugal |language=pt}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |date=2023-12-16 |title=Pedro Nuno Santos eleito secretário-geral do PS com 62% |url=https://sicnoticias.pt/pais/2023-12-16-Pedro-Nuno-Santos-eleito-secretario-geral-do-PS-com-62-2af44f67 |access-date=2025-09-13 |website=SIC Notícias |language=pt}}</ref>
The [[Government of Portugal|Portuguese government]] responded to the strikes with a combination of public appeals and legislative measures. Prime Minister [[António Costa]], facing increasing pressure, resigned in November 2023 amid a corruption investigation involving several government officials.<ref>{{Cite news |last=Jones |first=Sam |date=2023-11-07 |title=Portuguese PM António Costa resigns amid corruption inquiry |url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/nov/07/portuguese-pm-antonio-costa-resigns-amid-corruption-inquiry |access-date=2025-09-13 |work=The Guardian |language=en-GB |issn=0261-3077}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |date=2023-11-07 |title=Portugal's prime minister resigns as his government is involved in a corruption investigation |url=https://apnews.com/article/portugal-corruption-arrests-costa-935d9f33c9e5179e920dc7e1bcd95eea |access-date=2025-09-13 |website=AP News |language=en}}</ref> Subsequently, the [[Socialist Party (Portugal)|Socialist Party]] held a [[2023 Portuguese Socialist Party leadership election|leadership election]] in December 2023, resulting in [[Pedro Nuno Santos]] becoming the new [[Secretary (title)|Secretary-General]].<ref>{{Cite web |title=PS vai escolher o próximo secretário-geral a 15 e 16 de dezembro. Congresso marcado para 6 e 7 de janeiro |url=https://cnnportugal.iol.pt/partido-socialista/congresso/ps-vai-escolher-o-proximo-secretario-geral-a-15-e-16-de-dezembro-congresso-marcado-para-6-e-7-de-janeiro/20231110/654d77f8d34e371fc0b9b434 |access-date=2025-09-13 |website=CNN Portugal |language=pt}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |date=2023-12-16 |title=Pedro Nuno Santos eleito secretário-geral do PS com 62% |url=https://sicnoticias.pt/pais/2023-12-16-Pedro-Nuno-Santos-eleito-secretario-geral-do-PS-com-62-2af44f67 |access-date=2025-09-13 |website=SIC Notícias |language=pt}}</ref>


Despite the political shifts, the [[government]]'s direct approach to the strikes remained largely unchanged. [[Public-sector trade union|Public sector unions]], particularly the [[General Confederation of the Portuguese Workers]] (CGTP), continued to demand substantial wage increases to match inflation rates.<ref>{{Cite web |date=2023-06-01 |title=Strike wave grows in Portugal despite trade unions' attempt to strangle it |url=https://www.wsws.org/en/articles/2023/06/01/eizs-j01.html |access-date=2025-09-13 |website=World Socialist Web Site |language=en}}</ref> The government's offers, such as the proposed 3.6% pay rise, fell short of union expectations and were perceived as insufficient given the high inflation rates.<ref>{{Cite news |date=2022-11-18 |title=Portugal's public sector workers strike over pay as living costs soar |url=https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/portugals-public-sector-workers-strike-over-pay-living-costs-soar-2022-11-18/ |access-date=2025-09-13 |work=Reuters |language=en}}</ref>
Despite the political shifts, the government's direct approach to the strikes remained largely unchanged. [[Public-sector trade union|Public-sector unions]], particularly the [[General Confederation of the Portuguese Workers]] (CGTP), continued to demand substantial wage increases to match inflation rates.<ref>{{Cite web |date=2023-06-01 |title=Strike wave grows in Portugal despite trade unions' attempt to strangle it |url=https://www.wsws.org/en/articles/2023/06/01/eizs-j01.html |access-date=2025-09-13 |website=World Socialist Web Site |language=en}}</ref> The government's offers, such as the proposed 3.6% pay rise, fell short of union expectations and were perceived as insufficient given the high inflation rates.<ref>{{Cite news |date=2022-11-18 |title=Portugal's public sector workers strike over pay as living costs soar |url=https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/portugals-public-sector-workers-strike-over-pay-living-costs-soar-2022-11-18/ |access-date=2025-09-13 |work=Reuters |language=en}}</ref>


== Strikes in 2025 ==
== Strikes in 2025 ==
A nationwide strike — [[Portugal]]’s largest after [[June]] 2013 — caused major disruption in various services like [[transport]], [[hospital]]s and [[school]]s as various unions protested against government labour reforms. The draft law simplified firing, lengthened fixed-term contracts and expanded minimum service requirements. [[Lisbon]]’s [[train station]] was largely shut, [[TAP Air Portugal]] cancelled most of it flights, and many hospital appointments were postponed. According to Prime Minister [[Luís Montenegro]] about 100-plus measures aimed to boost growth and wages, but major unions, including the [[General Confederation of the Portuguese Workers|CGTP]] and General Union of Workers UGT, condemn the proposed changes. The CGTP staged about 20 demonstrations, calling the reforms a major attack on workers’ rights.<ref>{{Cite web |title=General strike in Portugal causes major disruptions in national services |url=https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2025/12/11/portugal-set-for-major-disruptions-in-first-general-strike-in-12-years}}</ref>
A nationwide strike – Portugal's largest after June 2013 – caused major disruption in various services like transport, hospitals and schools as various unions protested against government labour reforms. The draft law simplified firing, lengthened fixed-term contracts and expanded minimum service requirements. [[Lisbon]]’s train station was largely shut, [[TAP Air Portugal]] cancelled most of it flights, and many hospital appointments were postponed. According to Prime Minister [[Luís Montenegro]] about 100-plus measures aimed to boost growth and wages, but major unions, including the [[General Confederation of the Portuguese Workers|CGTP]] and General Union of Workers UGT, condemn the proposed changes. The CGTP staged about 20 demonstrations, calling the reforms a major attack on workers’ rights.<ref>{{Cite web |title=General strike in Portugal causes major disruptions in national services |url=https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2025/12/11/portugal-set-for-major-disruptions-in-first-general-strike-in-12-years}}</ref>

'''Blip.pl''' (or just '''Blip''') was a Polish [[social networking]] internet service, founded in May 2007 and currently owned by Gadu-Gadu. It had [[microblogging]] capability. Soon after being established, it was purchased by Gadu-Gadu S.A in June 2007.
'''Blip.pl''' (or just '''Blip''') was a Polish [[social networking]] internet service, founded in May 2007 and currently owned by Gadu-Gadu. It had [[microblogging]] capability. Soon after being established, it was purchased by Gadu-Gadu S.A in June 2007.


About 329,000 people visited the site in June 2009.<ref>{{cite web|first=Dominik|last=Szarek|url=http://interaktywnie.com/biznes/newsy/raporty-i-badania/prawie-1-2-mln-internautow-korzysta-z-mikroblogow-537|title=Prawie 1,2 mln internautów korzysta z mikroblogów|website=interaktywnie.com|date=5 October 2009|language=Polish}}</ref> In October 2009 the number of posts on the network exceeded ten million.<ref>{{cite web|first=Agata|last=Kozak|url=http://www.bliplog.pl/10-milionow-wiadomosci-wyslanych-na-blipie-dzieki/415|title=10 milionów wiadomości wysłanych na Blipie! Dzięki!|website=Bliplog.pl|date=20 October 2009|language=Polish|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120315220434/http://www.bliplog.pl/10-milionow-wiadomosci-wyslanych-na-blipie-dzieki/415|archive-date=15 March 2012|url-status=live}}</ref> By 4 December 2010 the service had 80,000 users.<ref>[http://stats.blipi.pl/blip Blipi.pl - statystyki.]</ref> Notable Polish celebrities and politicians, such as [[Lech Wałęsa]] and [[Grzegorz Napieralski]], used the site.<ref>{{cite web|first=Daniel|last=Kotowski|url=http://di.com.pl/news/27579,0,Slawy_na_Blipie_droga_do_sukcesu.html|title=Sławy na Blipie drogą do sukcesu?|website=W: Dziennik Internautów|date=17 July 2009|language=Polish}}</ref> The service was used as a communication channel of various governmental services, for example [[Zakład Ubezpieczeń Społecznych|ZUS]].<ref>{{Cite web|date=20 October 2009|title=Blip: ZUS zaczął blipować|first=Mariusz|last=Koryszewski|url=http://technologie.gazeta.pl/technologie/1,81010,7163714,Blip__ZUS_zaczal_blipowac.html|language=Polish|url-status=dead|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140323164309/http://technologie.gazeta.pl/technologie/1,81010,7163714,Blip__ZUS_zaczal_blipowac.html|archive-date=23 March 2014|access-date=1 July 2019|website=gazeta.pl}}</ref>
About 329,000 people visited the site in June 2009.<ref>{{cite web|first=Dominik|last=Szarek|url=http://interaktywnie.com/biznes/newsy/raporty-i-badania/prawie-1-2-mln-internautow-korzysta-z-mikroblogow-537|title=Prawie 1,2 mln internautów korzysta z mikroblogów|website=interaktywnie.com|date=5 October 2009|language=Polish}}</ref> In October 2009 the number of posts on the network exceeded ten million.<ref>{{cite web|first=Agata|last=Kozak|url=http://www.bliplog.pl/10-milionow-wiadomosci-wyslanych-na-blipie-dzieki/415|title=10 milionów wiadomości wysłanych na Blipie! Dzięki!|website=Bliplog.pl|date=20 October 2009|language=Polish|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120315220434/http://www.bliplog.pl/10-milionow-wiadomosci-wyslanych-na-blipie-dzieki/415|archive-date=15 March 2012|url-status=live}}</ref> By 4 December 2010 the service had 80,000 users.<ref>[http://stats.blipi.pl/blip Blipi.pl - statystyki.]</ref> Notable Polish celebrities and politicians, such as [[Lech Wałęsa]] and [[Grzegorz Napieralski]], used the site.<ref>{{cite web|first=Daniel|last=Kotowski|url=http://di.com.pl/news/27579,0,Slawy_na_Blipie_droga_do_sukcesu.html|title=Sławy na Blipie drogą do sukcesu?|website=W: Dziennik Internautów|date=17 July 2009|language=Polish}}</ref> The service was used as a communication channel of various governmental services, for example [[Social Insurance Institution (Poland)|ZUS]].<ref>{{Cite web|date=20 October 2009|title=Blip: ZUS zaczął blipować|first=Mariusz|last=Koryszewski|url=http://technologie.gazeta.pl/technologie/1,81010,7163714,Blip__ZUS_zaczal_blipowac.html|language=Polish|url-status=dead|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140323164309/http://technologie.gazeta.pl/technologie/1,81010,7163714,Blip__ZUS_zaczal_blipowac.html|archive-date=23 March 2014|access-date=1 July 2019|website=gazeta.pl}}</ref>


Blip was closed on 2 September 2013, following a two-month advance notice. ← Previous revision Revision as of 10:58, 8 February 2026
Line 30: Line 30:
== Team Mascot/Name ==
== Team Mascot/Name ==


I changed the section for the team mascot. I was on the Student Council in 1990-1992. We had passed out the slips to the student body for a multiple choice of 4 different mascot / team name / moniker for the students to vote on. On usual High School fashion turnout was very low so the teachers decided to pick and settle on Bulls. This was due to the recent uptick in gang activity in the schools and in the city of Pittsburgh ( Bloods in the Hill District, Crips on Northside / Northview Heights/ Arlington / St. Clair Village and LAW in Wilkensburg. [[User:Mellifleur|Mellifleur]] ([[User talk:Mellifleur|talk]]) 10:57, 8 February 2026 (UTC)
I changed the section for the team mascot. I was on the Student Council in 1990-1992. We had passed out the slips to the student body for a multiple choice of 4 different mascot / team name / moniker for the students to vote on. In usual High School fashion turnout was very low so the teachers decided to pick and settle on Bulls. This was due to the recent uptick in gang activity in the schools and in the city of Pittsburgh ( Bloods in the Hill District, Crips on Northside / Northview Heights/ Arlington / St. Clair Village and LAW in Wilkensburg. This was not due to parental concern, this was an administrative move through both Pittsburgh Public Schools and the school itself. [[User:Mellifleur|Mellifleur]] ([[User talk:Mellifleur|talk]]) 10:57, 8 February 2026 (UTC)
